page.title: 13DISUSED CANAL - KEMPSFORD
page.content: {The Stroudwater, Severn and Thames {Canal}which was opened in 1789 to connect the {Rivers Severn}and{Thames and on which the last cargo was carried in 1911 passes through the area. This section was officially abandoned in 1927. Its most profitable period was from 1840 until the railways took over most of its trade. Most of the{canal}has been filled in to become part of the large wheat fields, although where small clumps of trees continue to grow, the line of the canal can be discerned. Two hump backed bridges stand isolated in fields. Lines of willows and ash trees also identify the old canal, leading onto what was the Agent's house, warehouse and wharf.
